Top-3 Scripts:
ul_471837: scp ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub root@SERVER:/tmp/id_andre_luiz
ssh root@SERVER
cat /tmp/id_andre_luiz >> ~USER/.ssh/authorized_keys

ul_302512: cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | ssh user@remote "mkdir /home/user/somedir/.ssh; \
cat >> /home/user/somedir/.ssh/authorized_keys; touch hello; mkdir /test/morning; \
cp hello /test/morning"

ul_94207: find . -type d -exec cp file {} \;

man find

-type c
          File is of type c:
           d      directory

   -exec command ;
          Execute  command;  All following arguments to find are taken 
          to be arguments to the command until an  argument  consisting 
          of `;' is encountered.  The string `{}' is replaced by the 
          current file

so_657108: PATH=${PATH}:$(find ~/code -type d | tr '\n' ':' | sed 's/:$//')

PATH=${PATH}:$(find ~/code -type d | sed '/\/\\./d' | tr '\n' ':' | sed 's/:$//')

PATH=${PATH}:$(find ~/code -type d -name '[^\.]*' | tr '\n' ':' | sed 's/:$//')
